alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Gates of the Mountains; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:52PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong cold front will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher, northwestern Judith Basin, northwestern Fergus, south central Teton, southwestern Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 550 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cold front along a line extending from 9 miles east of Fort Benton to 8 miles southwest of Great Falls to 8 miles northeast of Augusta. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds shifting from out of the west to out of the north could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Benton, Cascade, Fairfield, Belt, Geraldine, Fort Shaw, Highwood, Black Eagle, Geyser, Fort Shaw, Augusta, Floweree, Eden, Stockett, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Shonkin, Ulm, Simms and Raynesford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
